result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clayton J. Harrison

defendant.name: Harrison, Clayton J.

records.addlTxt: 10:29 AM Defendant Clayton J. Harrison appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Clayton J. Harrison. Defendant Harrison is agreeable to appear in front of Judge Becker on 22CF74, no threats or promises. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Counts 1 & 4.  Remaining counts DRI. 22CF74 DRI.

10:29 AM Defendant Clayton J. Harrison appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Clayton J. Harrison. Defendant Harrison is agreeable to appear in front of Judge Becker on 22CF74, no threats or promises. Defendant agrees to appear remotely. 
Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:15 PM Defendant Clayton J. Harrison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Clayton J. Harrison. 
Waive reading of the complaint.  STC set for 8/29 @ 3pm if needed. Set for a plea/sent hearing tentatively on 8/2 at 10:30am with Judge Becker.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on July 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. 

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin. 

Cash bond covers cases 21CF124 & 22CF74

1:01 PM Defendant Clayton J. Harrison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Marsolek  in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant needs to call the SPD for assignment on this case. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. He will contact SPD.  AIA set for   at 9 am. with Judge Diehn. Text reminders 715 540 8063. Homeless. Discontinue address on record. Drop off notice at JC jail. Court finds probable cause.
9:45 AM Defendant Clayton J. Harrison not in court.  Attorney Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. AWA authorized.
